intro: Amblynotopsis peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular amblynotopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
